items.title: India to cut Russian oil purchases, U.S. to slash tariffs as they near trade deal: Indian media report
items.description: The India-U.S. trade talks collapsed earlier this year with New Delhi not agreeing to widen market access to its vast agricultural and dairy sectors.

items.title: This week's critical inflation report comes with a variety of doubts about the data
items.description: The September CPI report will command full attention from financial markets, even as some investors will view the data with a skeptical eye.

items.title: Rare earths make gains amid battle to beat Chinaâ€™s dominance
items.description: Shares of U.S.-listed companies related to the rare earth supply chain climbed on Monday.

items.title: Tariff costs to companies this year to hit $1.2 trillion, with consumers taking most of the hit, S&P says
items.description: The firm said its estimate of additional expenses for companies is probably conservative.

items.title: U.S. budget deficit edged lower in 2025 as tariffs, debt payments both saw new records
items.description: The federal government managed to escape with a $1.78 trillion shortfall, some $41 billion, or 2.2%, less than fiscal 2024.
